availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William T. Vaughan (Christian County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Ann Elliott Vaughan in Montgomery County, Tennessee, on May 29, 1860. Father of Mollie A. Vaughan and Katie Bell Vaughan. Student in Christian County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned sixteen enslaved persons in Christian County in 1850. Farmer in Christian County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Christian County in 1860. Farmer in Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 2, p. 391B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 2, p. 167.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, p. 705.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, p. 282A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 3, p. 494B.
Consolidated List of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Muhlenberg County, KY, July 1863, p. 46.
Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, Montgomery County Marriages, 1838-1874, p. 96.
